resources.string: It\'s far better to do something than nothing at all!
Check to make sure the person is unconscious. Tap the shoulder and loudly ask \"Are you okay?\"
If the person is unresponsive, dial 911 or tell someone to do it.
Use an AED first if available. Then, begin chest compressions at 100 beats per minute until help arrives.
1. To do this, place the heel of one hand in the middle of the person\'s chest. Place your other hand on top.
2. Keeping your elbows straight and your shoulders directly above your hands, push straight down and hard at least 2 inches on the person\'s chest at 100 BPM.
